description.narrative: This project College of health sciences and health educationwill emerge from SEMCON-friends association's previous development co-operation projects. A health center a hospital a motherless babies home and a nursing school with secondary buildings have bee n built after year 2000 into Mgboko Ofokobe rain forest village in Nigeria with development co-operation funding.Based to requirements raised by Nigerian partner and local authorities there is an increased need to educate other heath care professionals tha n nurses for example Junior Community Health Extension Workers Nursing Senior Community Health Extension Workers Public Health Administration Health Information Management Public Healt Science and Community Healt Science. Abia State has two other nursing s chools but none of them offer so diverse qualifications as required (fulfilling a need for diverse skills educational establishements). The initative to extend the areas of education and training fields has come from local authorities.The goal is to educat e various levels of health care profesionals. The school gives young people the opportunity to graduate profession and will continue to support themselves either someone's else's payroll or by setting up their own business. The school is using the hospital which we built as a training place and the students offer health education towards the villages and schools on regional level.All of the local residents are actually benebicaries primarily young trainees. The goal is is to teach heelth habits includinh ha nd hygiene importance of sanitary health food reproductive health for seeking appropriate medical care when required malaria treatment HIV/AIDS knowledge vaccination program maternity clinics...The project will be utilizing the existing structure further e xixting operations. The aim is to complete the area with couple of buildings which will cover among other things teacher's officies. Additionally existing buildings will be acquired more furniture and materials as well as equipment for teaching. A school w ill receive official permits recruited staff and it can start to be operational. At the same time the operation and development of medical education on the village will be supported.
